header: update 1-wachovia raises q3 profit view for wal-mart
body:
Nov 11 (Reuters) - Wachovia Capital Markets raised its third-quarter earnings estimate for Wal-Mart Stores Inc (WMT.N) on solid sales performance, but trimmed its fourth-quarter view to reflect emerging foreign exchange headwinds and less share buyback activity.

Shares of the world’s largest retailer, which is scheduled to release third-quarter earnings on Thursday, closed down 43 cents at $54.75 Tuesday on the New York Stock Exchange.

Wachovia, which kept its “outperform” rating on the stock, raised its third-quarter earnings view for the discount-chain retailer by a cent to 76 cents.

It sees fourth-quarter earnings per share of $1.08, down from its prior view of $1.10. (Reporting by Nivedita Bhattacharjee in Bangalore; Editing by Deepak Kannan)
